alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 10:32PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. The northern half of the Owens Valley is the primary area of concern. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bishop, Big Pine, Independence, Baker Creek Campground, Glacier View Campground, Tinemaha Campground, Taboose Creek Campground, Goodale Creek Campground, Wilkerson, Browns Town Campground, Millpond Campground, Independence Creek Campground, Pleasant Valley Campground, Mesa, Round Valley, West Bishop, Dixon Lane-Meadow and Dixon Lane-Meadow Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
